algorithm_technique: Perform a post-order traversal of the binary tree. For each node, calculate the sum and count of its subtree, then compute the average and update the maximum.
problem_summary_simple: Find the subtree with the highest average value in a binary tree.
problem_summary_technical: Utilize a recursive post-order traversal. Each node returns its subtree sum and node count to its parent.
key_insights: A post-order traversal is suitable because we need subtree information from children before processing the parent.
The helper function returns both the sum and count of nodes in the subtree.
The maximum average is tracked globally as we traverse the tree.
